_set_attribute_from_yaml(attr_name: str, yaml_path: list, value_type: type) → None¶

Helper function to set attribute from parsed YAML.

Parameters:

  • attr_name (str) – The name of the attribute to set.

  • yaml_path (list) – The list of keys to navigate the YAML dictionary.

  • value_type (type) – The type to cast the value to (e.g., int, float, str).

load_yaml(config_file_path: str) → None¶

Loads settings from a YAML file.

Parameters:

config_file_path (str) – Configuration File Path

set_defaults() → None¶

Sets default values for all attributes.

set_options(options: Namespace) → None¶

Sets other options based on parsed YAML and command-line options.

setup_logging(options) → None¶

Initializes logging based on parsed YAML.

modules.Environment module¶

class modules.Environment.Environment¶

Bases: object

Represents the environment for the network simulation.

The Environment class primarily acts as a structure for storing information about various network elements like configuration, device info, application info, network links, etc.

current_time¶

The date and time of the current event.

Type:

int

config¶

Environment configuration.

Type:

Config

devices¶

List of Device objects.

Type:

List[Device]

applications¶

List of Application objects to be deployed.

Type:

List[Application]

physical_network_links¶

List of physical network links between devices.

Type:

List[PhysicalNetworkLink]

...
TIME_PERIOD: int = 8640000¶
add_application(application: Application)¶

Adds a new Application to the applications list.

The id_to_application dictionary is updated as well.

Parameters:

application (Application) – The Application object to be added.

add_device(device: Device)¶

Adds a new Device to the devices list.

The id_to_device dictionary is updated along the way. We use a trick so that dictionary members are either a single device or a list.

Parameters:

device (Device) – The Device object to be added.

property applications: List[Application]¶

Get the list of Application objects in the environment.

Returns:

The list of Application objects representing network applications.

Return type:

List[Application]

property config: Config | None¶

Get the Config object for the environment.

Returns:

The Config object, or None if not set.

Return type:

Optional[Config]

property devices: List[Device]¶

Get the list of Device objects in the environment.

Returns:

The list of Device objects representing network devices.

Return type:

List[Device]

extract_values()¶
generate_application_list() → None¶

Generates a list of Application objects and appends them to self.applications.

The number of applications to be generated is retrieved from self.config.number_of_applications.

Raises:

ValueError – If the config is not initialized.

generate_device_list()¶
generate_other_routing_table(k_param=-1)¶

Generates a routing table on each device in self.devices The function first lists the neighboring device, then iterate on the list to build a routing table based on shortest distance among links This is bruteforcing the shortest path betweend devices, we can probably create a better algorithm, but this is not the point for now.

generate_routing_table()¶

Generates a routing table on each device in self.devices The function first lists the neighboring device, then iterate on the list to build a routing table based on shortest distance among links This is bruteforcing the shortest path betweend devices, we can probably create a better algorithm, but this is not the point for now. TODO : Fix duplicated entries in routing table

get_application_by_id(app_id: int) → Application¶

Gets the Application whose ID matches app_id.

Parameters:

app_id (int) – Application identifier.

Returns:

The Application object with the matching ID.

Return type:

Application

Raises:

ApplicationNotFoundError – If no application is found.

get_device_by_id(dev_id: int) → Device¶

Gets the Device whose ID matches dev_id. Device IDs are supposed to be unique by construction.

Parameters:

dev_id (int) – Device identifier.

Returns:

The device with the matching ID.

Return type:

Device

get_random_device() → Device¶

Get a random Device from the list of devices.

Returns:

A random Device object.

Return type:

Device

Raises:

DeviceNotFoundError – If no devices are available.

modules.ResourceManagement module¶

modules.ResourceManagement.custom_distance(A, B)¶

Defines a custom distance for device wireless coverage to account for less coverage due to floor interception.

If A and B are not of the same size, distance is calculated among the first values up to min(len(A),len(B))

Args:¶

Alist

List of coords for point A

Blist

List of coords for point B

Returns:¶

distanceint

Distance (as coverage) between A and B.
